page.title: 04Buildings Polperro Lansallos
page.content: The architecture of Polperro is predominately old-some 300 years at least. Most of it has been modified or altered to bring it up to a reasonable modern standard,although the basic shapes and fabrics remain unchanged. Many properties have been converted to shop,cafes and restaraunts to cater for the tourists. Some of the walls are 0.7 metres thick but without damproofing the houses are not the most comfortable. Many of the Harbourside and streamside properties are 3 storey's high, the lower one originally being used for net storage etc. The still get flooded during 'spring' tides even though most are now lived in.Polperro's popularity with tourists has caused the cost of even a small 'fishermans' cottage to rise beyond the means of most local families.
